definition: to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
lots (to be drawn)/lot (in a game of chance)

sentences.english: Before entering their rooms, they still did the routine work and drew the lot.
sentences.chinese: 进入房间前，他们又按惯例抓阄配对。

sentences.english: At the outset, they decided whom to Stop hours congee, a daily round.
sentences.chinese: 一开始，他们抓阄决定谁来分粥，每天轮一个。

sentences.english: They use draw lots of ways to election the "LEADERS".
In Athens at that time, judges were chosen by lot.
sentences.chinese: 在那时的雅典，法官是通过抓阄来选定的。

sentences.english: Fiona Niang first draw, caught the word "death".
sentences.chinese: 贞娘先抓阄，抓到了“死”字。

sentences.english: For a start, they decided whom to congee, a daily round.
sentences.chinese: 一开始，他们抓阄决定谁来分粥，每天轮一个。

sentences.english: They drew lots for the right to go first .
sentences.chinese: 他们抓阄儿决定谁先走。

definition: to read ballot slips out loud
to sleep in separate rooms/distribution of social housing
to abstain from voting/to forfeit/to waive one's right to vote/to abdicate
clapper-board/auctioneer's hammer/to beat time with clappers
to try one's luck/to leave sth to chance
to divide people into groups, teams, squads etc
first decapitate then present your trophy (idiom); act first, report later
to pool resources (for a gift, project etc)
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
to draw a tile (at mahjong)/to play mahjong
to reach an agreement/to agree upon
number off! (command in military drill)/count off!
